II Radio waves travel at 340 m s⁻¹ through air.
III Ultraviolet waves have a longer wavelength than infrared waves.[/s]Which of these statements is/are correct?

Alpha radiation ionises an atom.

Which statement describes what happens to the atom?
option_d: The atom gives out gamma radiation.

question_text:

The equivalent dose received by the tissue is
[s]I reduced by shielding the tissue with a lead screen
II increased as the distance from the source to the tissue is increased
III increased by increasing the time of exposure of the tissue to the radiation.[/s]Which of the statements is/are correct?

question_text:

option_c: the air resistance is greater than the weight of the spacecraft
option_d: the weight of the spacecraft is greater than the air resistance
